channel.title: Communication Sites
channel.description:
Hey! A lot of my friends want me to make myself an account on one of the communication sites. I see no point when I can just call my friends up, and go see them. I've told them that I see no reason in creating one. They just say: "Just do it, you'll love it!" They won't get off my back about it. Help? Explain why I should make one?
[b]EDIT:[/b]Lots of people are now sending me emails saying: "Just try Facebook. It's actually quite helpful. It's basically just a big organization like Mopar. It's free to use, and you get to see hot girls in Bikini's that you know!" I laughed my butt off! Reason being: I hang with the hottest girls around all the time. I'm usually at the mall with these girls. Also, I live right next to the beach! :)

item.title: Communication Sites
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:28, topic:413169”][quote author=Charles Handson link=topic=514641.msg3740338#msg3740338 date=1315275042]

Ah, you haven’t been here long enough to understand what I meant.

Total time logged in: 118 days, 8 hours and 30 minutes.
Posts: 13,454 (13.062 per day)

But you’ve been here since November 9th, 2008

That’s 3 years, 4500 posts a year, roughly 12 per day. 12 posts a day isn’t to much.

You make it sound bad.
[/quote]
I’m just saying you over exaggerated it.[/quote]
Not really… as long as your logged in and the computer going while on the site it’ll still count.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:413169”]I have a facebook.

…

Nuff said[/quote]

I’m not trying to “hate on you”. I just think it’s pointless, unless: a close friend moves; girlfriend moves; Family member moves; Etc… which noboby I know has strangly.

item.title: Communication Sites
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I guess if there’s no other way of communicating to certain people, then Facebook would be necessary. MySpace is awful, and only useful for washed-up garage bands and hipsters who think Facebook is too mainstream for them.

Read full topic
